contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox writer |name =Chábeli Iglesias |image = |caption = |birth_name =María Isabel Iglesias Preysler |birth_date ={{birth date and age |1971|9|3|df=y}} |birth_place =[[Cascais]], [[Portugal]] |occupation =[[Journalist]] }} '''Chábeli Iglesias''' (born 3 September 1971) is a Spanish socialite. She was born in [[Cascais]] in [[Portugal]], the daughter of Spanish singer [[Julio Iglesias]] and [[Philippines|Filipina]] socialite [[Isabel Preysler]].<ref>{{cite news | title= The Filipino People's Ancestry:Julio Iglesias Jr. and Chabel Iglesias in Traditional Filipino Clothing | url=http://pinoyblogmachine.com/2007/10/03/the-filipino-peoples-ancestry-julio-iglesias-jr-and-chabel-iglesias-in-traditional-filipino-clothing/| publisher = Pinoy Blog Machine (Beta) | date=2007-10-03}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url= http://www.geocities.com/preyslerphil/FamilyTree.pdf | title=Preysler Family | publisher=www.geocities.com|archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/query?url=http://www.geocities.com/preyslerphil/FamilyTree.pdf&date=2009-10-26+00:42:56|archivedate=2009-10-26}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=http://filipinocultured.blogspot.com/2007/10/julio-iglesias-jr-and-chabel-iglesias.html | title=Filipino Peoples' Real Ancestry | publisher=Filipino Cultured | author=R. Arce}}</ref> She is the older sister of singers [[Julio Iglesias Jr.]] and [[Enrique Iglesias]]. Iglesias has appeared in many local and international covers of gossip and entertainment magazines worldwide, at a young age, as the entertainment industry made the Iglesias family one of their favourite celebrities. After the kidnapping of her grandfather in 1985, her father Julio Iglesias decided to move her and her brothers to safety in [[Miami, Florida|Miami]] in the [[United States]], where she lived in protective custody. During the 1990s, Iglesias, appeared in several [[United States|American]] talk shows and this was followed by a [[television]] show called ''El Show de Chabeli'', which aired on [[Univision]]. She was married to Ricardo Bofill Jr, the son of Spanish architect, [[Ricardo Bofill]]. Their marriage ended several years later. In June 1999, Iglesias was involved in a car accident in [[Los Angeles, California|Los Angeles]] in California, requiring hospitalization. The police declared that with the kind of injuries she had, only one out of a million people would survive. She was in the passenger seat when the vehicle rolled over several times and both passengers were ejected.<ref>{{cite news |title=Julio Iglesias' Daughter Isabel Hurt in Crash |publisher=Los Angeles Times |date=1999-06-22 |url=http://articles.latimes.com/keyword/chabeli-iglesias}}</ref> On 8 October 2001, she married businessman [[Christian Altaba]]. Their son Alejandro was born prematurely on 14 January 2002. The godparents of Alejandro were Julio Iglesias Jr. and Ana Boyer. On 2 February 2010, she announced that she was pregnant with twin girls that were expected to be born in Summer 2010, however, on March 12, 2010 [[People en Español]] reported that Chábeli had suffered a [[miscarriage]].<ref>http://www.peopleenespanol.com/pespanol/articles/0,22490,1971690,00.html</ref> In February 2012 she announced that she and her husband became parents of a daughter, Sofia on January 4th 2012 after a pregnancy kept totally secret. == References == {{reflist}} ==External links== *{{es icon}} [http://www.buscabiografias.com/cgi-bin/verbio.cgi?id=4510 Chabeli Iglesias - Biography] {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Iglesias, Chabeli | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Spanish journalist | DATE OF BIRTH =3 September 1971 | PLACE OF BIRTH =[[Cascais]], [[Portugal]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Iglesias, Chabeli}} [[Category:1971 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People of Kapampangan descent]] [[Category:People from Madrid]] [[Category:Spanish journalists]] [[Category:Spanish people of Filipino descent]]
